description: Climate data for two localities in East Africa for use in GaiaCatalog. GaiaCatalog is a component in the OHDSI GIS Toolchain
dateCreated: use to specify the date the dataset was initially generated (e.g., when a sensor recorded a value, when a model was run, or when data processing was completed)
dateModified: use to specify the date the dataset was most recently updated or changed
datePublished: use to specify the date when a dataset was made available to the public through a publication process
expires: use to specify the date when the dataset expires and is no longer useful or available
license: This work is licensed under a  Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY) 4.0 License

isBasedOn.name: ERA5
isBasedOn.description: ERA5 is the fifth generation ECMWF reanalysis for the global climate and weather for the past 8 decades. Data is available from 1940 onwards. ERA5 replaces the ERA-Interim reanalysis.

appearance.headline: Effect of climate change on the HIV response
appearance.text: Climate change [through a series of intervening variables] may increase the rates of HIV infection and worsen the health and wellbeing of people with HIV. Impacts on HIV programmes and people with HIV can manifest as reduced access to prevention, testing, and treatment services, poor adherence to treatment, poor nutrition,and reduced immunity.

firstAppearance.creditText: Lieber M, Chin-Hong P, Whittle HJ, Hogg R, Weiser SD
firstAppearance.headline: The Synergistic Relationship Between Climate Change and the HIV/AIDS Epidemic: A Conceptual Framework
firstAppearance.text: Four pathways linking climate change with HIV/AIDS are summarized in Fig. 1. This model is based on an in-depth literature review of the interaction between climate change, food insecurity, infectious diseases, human migration, destruction of healthcare infrastructure, and HIV/AIDS performed between June 6 and June 27, 2019.

spatialCoverage.name: Magu/Nairobi
spatialCoverage.description: HIV and Climate Change Study locations of interest

geo.name: Lake Victoria Basin
geo.description: The Lake Victoria Basin is a vast, shared transboundary resource spanning portions of Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda, Rwanda, and Burundi. It encompasses the lake itself, the surrounding catchment area, and the numerous communities and ecosystems dependent on its water resources. The basin is a vital source of water, food, and livelihoods for millions of people and plays a significant role in regional economies and biodiversity
geo.disambiguatingDescription: The basin covers a group of cells in a geospatial grid. Each cell in the grid is a GeoShape. The GeoShape is square

item.box: A box is the area enclosed by the rectangle formed by two points. The first point is the lower corner, the second point is the upper corner. A box is expressed as two points separated by a space character

actionProcess.disambiguatingDescription: Uses Standardized Precipitation Index (SPI) and/or related drought indices

geo.name: Magu
geo.description: We used the geocoordinates of the centroid of the Magu HDSS and applied a 10 km buffer around it
geo.disambiguatingDescription: This buffer helped account for potential inaccuracies in the centroid coordinates and the limited resolution of the climate data
geo.circle: A circle is the circular region of a specified radius centered at a specified latitude and longitude. A circle is expressed as a pair followed by a radius in meters.

potentialAction.description: Determines the Copernicus cell at ground level in which the Magu circle mostly lies
potentialAction.disambiguatingDescription: Alternatively, I would still suggest using village locations to join the environmental data to the patient data

geo.description: Finds a Copernicus cell in which the circle that buffers the centroid of the Magu district mostly lies
geo.box: A box is the area enclosed by the rectangle formed by two points. The first point is the lower corner, the second point is the upper corner. A box is expressed as two points separated by a space character

geo.description: Finds a Copernicus cell in which a person's Magu village mostly lies
geo.box: A box is the area enclosed by the rectangle formed by two points. The first point is the lower corner, the second point is the upper corner. A box is expressed as two points separated by a space character

geo.description: Use for joining patient location with a Copernicus cell corresponding to the circle

temporal: It may be we will want to support two or more temporal resolutions, depending upon the patterns that they surface. Two are specified in temporalCoverage. The first is the monthly average (P1M) beginning in 1994 every year for 20 years (R20). temporalCoverge is a shorthand for temporal using ISO 8601. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601
measurementTechnique: ERA5 Climate Reanalysis of Copernicus satellite data

publishingPrinciples.name: Document related to principles related to the publishing of this information

provider.legalName: African Population and Health Research Center
provider.name: APHRC

variableMeasured.name: Average maximum temperature - January 1994
variableMeasured.description: The maximum temperature for a month is calculated by averaging the daily high temperatures recorded during that month
variableMeasured.disambiguatingDescription: This involves collecting the highest temperature recorded each day, summing those values, and then dividing by the total number of days in the month.
